toll.英释: if a large bell tolls, or if you toll it, it keeps ringing slowly, especially to show that someone has died

echo.英释: a sound that you hear again after a loud noise, because it was made near something such as a wall

axis.英释: the imaginary line around which a large round object, such as the Earth, turns

zeal.英释: eagerness to do something, especially to achieve a particular religious or political aim

vain.中释: 徒劳的；自负的；无结果的；无用的
vain.英释: someone who is vain is too proud of their good looks, abilities, or position – used to show disapproval

drub.英释: to beat as with a stick; cudgel; club

fuse.中释: 保险丝，熔线；导火线，雷管
fuse.英释: a short thin piece of wire inside electrical equipment which prevents damage by melting and stopping the electricity when there is too much power

odds.英释: In betting, odds are expressions with numbers such as "10 to 1" and "7 to 2" that show how likely something is thought to be, for example, how likely a particular horse is to lose or win a race

prim.中释: (Prim)人名；(法、德、匈、捷、瑞典、西、葡)普里姆

cant.中释: 行话的；哀诉声的；假仁假义的

line.中释: 排成一行；划线于；以线条标示；使…起皱纹
line.英释: to form rows along the sides of something

tour.中释: 旅行，在……旅游；在……作巡回演出

heat.英释: to make something become warm or hot

waif.中释: 流浪者；流浪儿；飘流物；无主物；信号旗
waif.英释: If you refer to a child or young woman as a waif, you mean that they are very thin and look as if they have nowhere to live

Iron.英释: You can use iron to describe the character or behaviour of someone who is very firm in their decisions and actions, or who can control their feelings well

fern.英释: a type of plant with green leaves shaped like large feathers, but no flowers

soda.英释: water that contains bubbles and is often added to alcoholic drinks

rust.英释: to become covered with rust, or to make something become covered in rust

edge.中释: 使锐利；将…开刃；给…加上边
edge.英释: to put something on the edge or border of something

stun.中释: 昏迷；打昏；惊倒；令人惊叹的事物

ruin.英释: to make someone lose all their money

watt.英释: a unit for measuring electrical power

bole.英释: the main part of a tree

wiry.中释: 金属线制的；金属丝般的；坚硬的；瘦长结实的；（噪音）尖细的
wiry.英释: someone who is wiry is thin but has strong muscles

wave.中释: 波动；波浪；高潮；挥手示意；卷曲
wave.英释: a line of raised water that moves across the surface of the sea

bond.英释: if two things bond with each other, they become firmly fixed together, especially after they have been joined with glue

wary.中释: 谨慎的；机警的；惟恐的；考虑周到的
wary.英释: someone who is wary is careful because they think something might be dangerous or harmful

mean.英释: the average amount, figure, or value

avow.中释: 承认；公开宣称；坦率承认
avow.英释: to make a public statement about something you believe in

foil.中释: 面向文件的翻译语言（file-Oriented interpretive language）

side.英释: in or on the side of something

stir.英释: to move a liquid or substance around with a spoon or stick in order to mix it together

plea.中释: 恳求，请求；辩解，辩护；借口，托辞
plea.英释: a request that is urgent or full of emotion

butt.英释: to hit or push against something or someone with your head

path.英释: a track that has been made deliberately or made by many people walking over the same ground

volt.中释: 伏特（电压单位）；环骑；闪避
volt.英释: a unit for measuring the force of an electric current

emit.英释: to send out gas, heat, light, sound etc

monk.英释: a member of an all-male religious group that lives apart from other people in a  monastery

beck.英释: (in N England) a stream, esp a swiftly flowing one

loot.英释: to steal things, especially from shops or homes that have been damaged in a war or  riot

loop.英释: a shape like a curve or a circle made by a line curving back towards itself, or a piece of wire, string etc that has this shape

beam.中释: 发送；以梁支撑；用…照射；流露
beam.英释: to send a radio or television signal through the air, especially to somewhere very distant

apex.英释: the top or highest part of something pointed or curved

idle.英释: if an engine idles, it runs slowly while the vehicle, machine etc is not moving

levy.英释: to officially say that people must pay a tax or charge

deft.中释: 灵巧的；机敏的；敏捷熟练的
deft.英释: a deft movement is skilful, and often quick

lewd.英释: using rude words or movements that make you think of sex

icon.中释: 图标；偶像；肖像，画像；圣像
icon.英释: a small sign or picture on a computer screen that is used to start a particular operation

plus.英释: used to show that one number or amount is added to another

cite.英释: to give the exact words of something that has been written, especially in order to support an opinion or prove an idea

mode.英释: a particular way or style of behaving, living or doing something

mock.中释: 仿制的，模拟的，虚假的，不诚实的
mock.英释: not real, but intended to be very similar to a real situation, substance etc

fold.英释: a line made in paper or material when you fold one part of it over another

term.英释: to use a particular word or expression to name or describe something

rapt.英释: so interested in something that you do not notice anything else

rate.英释: if you rate someone or something, you think they are very good

scar.英释: a feeling of fear or sadness that remains with you for a long time after an unpleasant experience

mite.中释: 极小量；小虫；小孩儿；微小的东西
mite.英释: a very small creature that lives in plants,  carpet s  etc

oust.英释: If someone is ousted from a position of power, job, or place, they are forced to leave it

mate.英释: if animals mate, they have sex to produce babies

veto.英释: if someone in authority vetoes something, they refuse to allow it to happen, especially something that other people or organizations have agreed

myth.中释: 神话；虚构的人，虚构的事
myth.英释: an ancient story, especially one invented in order to explain natural or historical events

mask.英释: to hide your feelings or the truth about a situation

mass.英释: to come together, or to make people or things come together, in a large group

veil.中释: 遮蔽；掩饰；以面纱遮掩；用帷幕分隔
veil.英释: to cover something with a veil

vein.中释: 使成脉络；象脉络般分布于

akin.中释: (Akin)人名；(土、瑞典、尼日利)阿金；(匈)奥金；(英)埃金

fray.中释: 使磨损；变得令人紧张、急躁
fray.英释: If something such as cloth or rope frays, or if something frays it, its threads or fibres start to come apart from each other and spoil its appearance

salt.中释: 用盐腌；给…加盐；将盐撒在道路上使冰或雪融化
salt.英释: to add salt to food to make it taste better

pomp.英释: all the impressive clothes, decorations, music etc that are traditional for an important official or public ceremony

area.英释: a particular part of a country, town etc

arid.中释: 干旱的；不毛的，[农] 荒芜的
arid.英释: arid land or an arid  climate  is very dry because it has very little rain

face.英释: to be opposite someone or something, or to be looking or pointing in a particular direction

ovum.中释: [细胞][组织] 卵；卵子；卵形装饰
ovum.英释: an egg, especially one that develops inside the mother’s body

cull.中释: 剔出来杀掉的动物；拣出的等外品

lung.英释: one of the two organs in your body that you breathe with

tube.中释: 使成管状；把…装管；用管输送

rail.英释: to complain angrily about something, especially something that you think is very unfair

cube.中释: 使成立方形；使自乘二次；量…的体积
cube.英释: to multiply a number by itself twice

fake.英释: made to look like a real material or object in order to deceive people

work.中释: 使工作；操作；经营；使缓慢前进
work.英释: to do the activities and duties that are part of your job

clan.英释: a large group of families who often share the same name

bass.英释: a bass instrument or voice produces low notes

base.英释: to have your main place of work, business etc in a particular place

bile.英释: a bitter green-brown liquid formed in the  liver  , which helps you to  digest  fats

coax.英释: to persuade someone to do something that they do not want to do by talking to them in a kind, gentle, and patient way

acne.中释: [皮肤] 痤疮，[皮肤] 粉刺
acne.英释: a medical problem which causes a lot of red spots on your face and neck and mainly affects young people

hone.英释: to make knives, swords etc sharp

acme.英释: the best and highest level of something

alto.英释: an alto instrument or voice produces notes at the second highest level, below a  soprano

seed.英释: to remove seeds from fruit or vegetables

unit.中释: 单位，单元；装置；[军] 部队；部件
unit.英释: an amount of something used as a standard of measurement

balk.英释: to stop someone or something from getting or achieving what they want

coil.英释: a continuous series of circular rings into which something such as wire or rope has been wound or twisted

pyre.英释: a high pile of wood on which a dead body is placed to be burned in a funeral ceremony

nude.英释: a painting, statue etc of someone not wearing clothes

peak.英释: used to talk about the best, highest, or greatest level or amount of something

whim.中释: 奇想；一时的兴致；怪念头；幻想
whim.英释: a sudden feeling that you would like to do or have something, especially when there is no important or good reason

gene.英释: a part of a cell in a living thing that controls what it looks like, how it grows, and how it develops. People get their genes from their parents

atom.英释: the smallest part of an  element  that can exist alone or can combine with other substances to form a  molecule

flag.英释: an expression meaning a country or organization and its beliefs, values, and people

brag.英释: to talk too proudly about what you have done, what you own etc – used to show disapproval

bray.英释: the loud harsh sound uttered by a donkey

slit.英释: A slit is a long narrow opening in something

dais.英释: a low stage in a room that you stand on when you are making a speech or performing, so that people can see and hear you

kiln.英释: a special oven for baking clay pots, bricks etc

bide.英释: to wait until the right moment to do something
